1.brief: properly, instrumental music; by implication, a poem set to notes
Asaph, the name of three Israelites, and of the family of the first
strength; as adjective, mighty; especially the Almighty (but used also of any deity)

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
perhaps properly, to arrange; but used figuratively (of words), to speak; rarely (in a destructive sense) to subdue
to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
the sun; by implication, the east; figuratively, a ray, i.e. (architectural) a notched battlement
as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
an entrance (the place or the act); specifically sunset or the west; also (adverb with preposition) towards

2.brief: Tsijon (as a permanent capital), a mountain of Jerusalem

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative

3.brief: to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing

to scratch, i.e. (by implication) to engrave, plough; hence (from the use of tools) to fabricate (of any material); figuratively, to devise (in a bad sense); hence (from the idea of secrecy) to be silent, to let alone; hence (by implication) to be deaf (as an accompaniment of dumbness)
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
(as noun) a circle, neighbour, or environs; but chiefly (as adverb, with or without preposition) around
to storm; by implication, to shiver, i.e. fear
properly, vehemence, i.e. (with or without preposition) vehemently; by implication, wholly, speedily, etc. (often with other words as an intensive or superlative; especially when repeated)

4.brief: to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)
near, with or among; often in general, to
the sky (as aloft; the dual perhaps alluding to the visible arch in which the clouds move, as well as to the higher ether where the celestial bodies revolve)
properly, the top; specifically, the highest (i.e. God); also (adverb) aloft, to Jehovah
near, with or among; often in general, to
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
a straight course, i.e. sail direct
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock

5.brief: to gather for any purpose; hence, to receive, take away, i.e. remove (destroy, leave behind, put up, restore, etc.)
to cut (off, down or asunder); by implication, to destroy or consume; specifically, to covenant (i.e. make an alliance or bargain, originally by cutting flesh and passing between the pieces)
a compact (because made by passing between pieces of flesh)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, a slaughter, i.e. the flesh of an animal; by implication, a sacrifice (the victim or the act)

6.brief: properly, to front, i.e. stand boldly out opposite; by implication (causatively), to manifest; figuratively, to announce (always by word of mouth to one present); specifically, to expose, predict, explain, praise
the sky (as aloft; the dual perhaps alluding to the visible arch in which the clouds move, as well as to the higher ether where the celestial bodies revolve)
the right (natural, moral or legal); also (abstractly) equity or (figuratively) prosperity
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
to judge, i.e. pronounce sentence (for or against); by implication, to vindicate or punish; by extenssion, to govern; passively, to litigate (literally or figuratively)

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are

7.brief: to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
perhaps properly, to arrange; but used figuratively (of words), to speak; rarely (in a destructive sense) to subdue
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity
to duplicate or repeat; by implication, to protest, testify (as by reiteration); intensively, to encompass, restore (as a sort of reduplication)

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative

8.brief: not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, a slaughter, i.e. the flesh of an animal; by implication, a sacrifice (the victim or the act)
to be right (i.e. correct); reciprocal, to argue; causatively, to decide, justify or convict
a step or (collectively, stairs, as ascending); usually a holocaust (as going up in smoke)
a front, i.e. part opposite; specifically a counterpart, or mate; usually (adverbial, especially with preposition) over against or before
properly, continuance (as indefinite extension); but used only (attributively as adjective) constant (or adverbially, constantly); ellipt. the regular (daily) sacrifice

9.brief: not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to take (in the widest variety of applications)
a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)
a bullock (apparently as breaking forth in wild strength, or perhaps as dividing the hoof)
prepared, i.e. full grown; spoken only (in plural) of he-goats, or (figuratively) leaders of the people

10.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
alive; hence, raw (flesh); fresh (plant, water, year), strong; also (as noun, especially in the feminine singular and masculine plural) life (or living thing), whether literally or figuratively
a copse of bushes; hence, a forest; hence, honey in the comb (as hived in trees)
properly, a dumb beast; especially any large quadruped or animal (often collective)
hence (the ox's head being the first letter of the alphabet, and this eventually used as a numeral) a thousand

11.brief: to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a bird (as covered with feathers, or rather as covering with wings), often collectively
a mountain or range of hills (sometimes used figuratively)
fulness of the breast; also a moving creature

12.brief: used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
the earth (as moist and therefore inhabited); by extension, the globe; by implication, its inhabitants; specifically, a particular land, as Babylonia, Palestine

13.brief: flesh (from its freshness); by extension, body, person; also (by euphemistically) the pudenda of aman
blood (as that which when shed causes death) of man or an animal; by analogy, the juice of the grape; figuratively (especially in the plural) bloodshed (i.e. drops of blood)
prepared, i.e. full grown; spoken only (in plural) of he-goats, or (figuratively) leaders of the people

14.brief: to slaughter an animal (usually in sacrifice)

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
properly, an extension of the hand, i.e. (by implication) avowal, or (usually) adoration; specifically, a choir of worshippers
to be safe (in mind, body or estate); figuratively, to be (causatively, make) completed; by implication, to be friendly; by extension, to reciprocate (in various applications)
an elevation, i.e. (adj.) lofty (compar.); as title, the Supreme
a promise (to God); also (concretely) a thing promised

15.brief: to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
tightness (i.e. figuratively, trouble); transitively, a female rival:
to pull off; hence (intensively) to strip, (reflex.) to depart; by implication, to deliver, equip (for fight); present, strengthen
to be heavy, i.e. in a bad sense (burdensome, severe, dull) or in a good sense (numerous, rich, honorable; causatively, to make weighty (in the same two senses)

16.brief: morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative

properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
properly, to score with a mark as a tally or record, i.e. (by implication) to inscribe, and also to enumerate; intensively, to recount, i.e. celebrate
an enactment; hence, an appointment (of time, space, quantity, labor or usage)
to lift, in a great variety of applications, literal and figurative, absolute and relative
a compact (because made by passing between pieces of flesh)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
the mouth (as the means of blowing), whether literal or figurative (particularly speech); specifically edge, portion or side; adverbially (with preposition) according to

17.brief: thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you
properly, chastisement; figuratively, reproof, warning or instruction; also restraint
to throw out, down or away (literally or figuratively)
a word; by implication, a matter (as spoken of) or thing; adverbially, a cause
properly, the hind part; generally used as an adverb or conjunction, after (in various senses)

18.brief: used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
to be pleased with; specifically, to satisfy adebt
adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)
adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)
to commit adultery; figuratively, to apostatize
properly, smoothness (of the tongue); also an allotment

19.brief: the mouth (as the means of blowing), whether literal or figurative (particularly speech); specifically edge, portion or side; adverbially (with preposition) according to
to send away, for, or out (in a great variety of applications)
bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)
the tongue (of man or animals), used literally (as the instrument of licking, eating, or speech), and figuratively (speech, an ingot, a fork of flame, a cove of water)
to link, i.e. gird; figuratively, to serve, (mentally) contrive

20.brief: properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry
a brother (used in the widest sense of literal relationship and metaphorical affinity or resemblance (like father))
perhaps properly, to arrange; but used figuratively (of words), to speak; rarely (in a destructive sense) to subdue
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
a mother (as the bond of the family); in a wide sense (both literally and figuratively (like father))
to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)

21.brief: to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application

to scratch, i.e. (by implication) to engrave, plough; hence (from the use of tools) to fabricate (of any material); figuratively, to devise (in a bad sense); hence (from the idea of secrecy) to be silent, to let alone; hence (by implication) to be deaf (as an accompaniment of dumbness)
to compare; by implication, to resemble, liken, consider
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
a form of the prefix 'k-', but used separately  as, thus, so
to be right (i.e. correct); reciprocal, to argue; causatively, to decide, justify or convict
to set in a row, i.e. arrange, put in order (in a very wide variety of applications)
an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)

22.brief: to separate mentally (or distinguish), i.e.(generally) understand
'I pray', 'now', or 'then'; added mostly to verbs (in the Imperative or Future), or to interjections, occasionally to an adverb or conjunction
to mislay, i.e. to be oblivious of, from want of memory or attention
properly, removal; used only (in the construction) adverb as conjunction, lest
to pluck off or pull to pieces; causatively to supply with food (as in morsels)
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle
to snatch away, whether in a good or a bad sense

23.brief: to slaughter an animal (usually in sacrifice)
properly, an extension of the hand, i.e. (by implication) avowal, or (usually) adoration; specifically, a choir of worshippers
to be heavy, i.e. in a bad sense (burdensome, severe, dull) or in a good sense (numerous, rich, honorable; causatively, to make weighty (in the same two senses)
to put (used in a great variety of applications, literal, figurative, inferentially, and elliptically)
a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
